name: Prospect
description: A solo agency prospect management and lead generation system for UI/UX and front-end development services. Features ideal client profiles, multi-channel outreach sequences, deal pipeline tracking, portfolio showcasing, and daily prospecting routines to help independent consultants systematically find and convert high-value clients.

stories.title: Local development environment setup
stories.description: Clear instructions to get the project running locally with all dependencies
acceptance: README.md contains complete setup instructions
Clone repository and run `bun install`
Copy `.env.example` to `.env.local` and configure variables
Run `docker compose up -d` to start PostgreSQL
Run `bunx drizzle-kit push` to apply database schema
Run `bun dev` to start development server on localhost:3000
Visit http://localhost:3000 to verify app loads
All environment variables documented in .env.example with descriptions
`bunx biome check .` passes with no errors
`bunx tsc --noEmit` passes with no type errors
`bun run build` completes successfully

stories.title: Project initialization
stories.description: Set up Next.js 16 project with TypeScript, Tailwind v4, shadcn/ui, Biome, Docker with PostgreSQL, Drizzle ORM, and Zod for a solo agency prospect management system
acceptance: Next.js 16 app created using: bunx create-next-app@latest prospect --ts --tailwind --biome --app --src-dir --use-bun --no-turbopack --no-import-alias
shadcn/ui initialized with: bunx shadcn@latest init -y --base-color=neutral
Project opened in Cursor with: cursor .
Docker Compose configured with PostgreSQL 16 container (port 5432, volume for persistence)
Drizzle ORM installed and configured with PostgreSQL adapter
Zod installed for runtime validation
Database schema defined with Drizzle tables: prospects, outreach_campaigns, touchpoints, deals, services, portfolio_items
Environment variables configured: DATABASE_URL for PostgreSQL connection
Global CSS includes prefers-color-scheme media queries for automatic light/dark mode
Typography scale uses clamp() for fluid sizing with professional, clean sans-serif font
Base layout is responsive with mobile-first approach
`bunx biome check .` passes with no errors
`bunx tsc --noEmit` passes with no type errors
`bun run build` completes successfully

stories.title: Ideal Client Profile database schema
stories.description: Define the database schema and Zod validation for Ideal Client Profiles (ICPs)
acceptance: Drizzle schema for icp table: id, name, industry_vertical, company_size_min, company_size_max, tech_stack_indicators (jsonb), pain_points (jsonb), budget_range_min, budget_range_max, trigger_events (jsonb), service_offering, created_at, updated_at
Zod schemas for ICP create/update validation
Database migration created and applied
TypeScript types exported from Drizzle schema
`bunx biome check .` passes with no errors
`bunx tsc --noEmit` passes with no type errors
`bun run build` completes successfully

stories.title: Ideal Client Profile API routes
stories.description: Create Next.js API routes for ICP CRUD operations
acceptance: GET /api/icp returns all ICPs with pagination
GET /api/icp/[id] returns single ICP by id
POST /api/icp creates new ICP with Zod validation
PUT /api/icp/[id] updates existing ICP
DELETE /api/icp/[id] soft deletes ICP
All routes return proper HTTP status codes and error messages
`bunx biome check .` passes with no errors
`bunx tsc --noEmit` passes with no type errors
`bun run build` completes successfully

API route: POST /api/prospects/[id]/score accepts ICP id and returns score breakdown
Score visualization shows which criteria matched/missed
